intro: Layia leucopappa, commonly known as the white layia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its white petals are surrounded by yellow ray florets, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Layia leucopappa is often found in California and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
